bt.protocol

Class Protocols

  • java.lang.Object
    • bt.protocol.Protocols

  • public class Protocols
extends Object
    Provides utility functions for binary protocol implementations.
    Since:
    1.0

      • readLong

        public static long readLong(byte[] bytes,
                            int offset)
        Decode the binary representation of a Long from a byte array.
        Parameters:
        bytes - Arbitrary byte array. It's length must be at least offset + 8.
        offset - Offset in byte array to start decoding from (inclusive, 0-based)
        Since:
        1.0

      • readLong

        public static Long readLong(ByteBuffer buffer)
        Decode the binary representation of a Long from a buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer to read from. Decoding will be done starting with the index denoted by Buffer.position()
        Returns:
        Decoded value, or null if there are insufficient bytes in buffer (i.e. buffer.remaining() < 8)
        Since:
        1.0

      • readInt

        public static int readInt(byte[] bytes,
                          int offset)
        Decode the binary representation of an Integer from a byte array.
        Parameters:
        bytes - Arbitrary byte array. It's length must be at least offset + 4.
        offset - Offset in byte array to start decoding from (inclusive, 0-based)
        Since:
        1.0

      • readInt

        Decode the binary representation of an Integer from a buffer.

      • readInt

        public static int readInt(ByteBufferView buffer)
        Decode the binary representation of an Integer from a buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer to read from. Decoding will be done starting with the index denoted by Buffer.position()
        Returns:
        Decoded value
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there are insufficient bytes in buffer (i.e. buffer.remaining() < 4)
        Since:
        1.9

      • canReadInt

        public static boolean canReadInt(ByteBufferView buffer)
        Check that remaining bytes in buffer are enough to read an int
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer to read from.
        Returns:

                                          int expectedLength,

        i - Bit index (0-based)

        i - Bit index (0-based)
        Returns:

        Since:

      • infoHashFromBase32

        public static byte[] infoHashFromBase32(String s)
        Get 20-bytes long info hash from its' base32-encoded representation (regardless of case).
        Parameters:
        s - base32-encoded representation of info hash
        Returns:
        Binary data
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if s.length() is not 32 characters long
        Since:
        1.8
